title: 97: Race, Class, and Inequality
itunes:author: Philosophy Talk Starters
itunes:summary:
More at http://philosophytalk.org/shows/race-class-and-inequality.

The concept of equality is as important to America's self-conception as it is confusing. What sort of equality? Equality before the law; equality of opportunity; equal access to all the benefits of modern society? If we treat everyone the same, how can we take account of inequities due to race, class, gender and other factors? John and Ken put these questions and more to Elizabeth Kiss from Duke University.
